tree.name: Rudy Gobert
tree.tradeDescription: Blockbuster trade: Timberwolves received Rudy Gobert from Jazz for Malik Beasley, Patrick Beverley, Walker Kessler, Jarred Vanderbilt, Leandro Bolmaro, 2023 1st, 2025 1st, 2027 1st, 2029 1st (top-5 protected), 2026 swap
tree.note: 4x Defensive Player of the Year, French center

assetsGivenUp.name: Malik Beasley
assetsGivenUp.note: Florida State guard, acquired from Denver in 4-team trade. MIN sent Robert Covington + Jordan Bell to HOU, and Keita Bates-Diop + Shabazz Napier + Noah Vonleh to DEN.

assetsGivenUp.name: Robert Covington
assetsGivenUp.note: Acquired from 76ers in Jimmy Butler trade, sent to HOU in 4-team trade

assetsGivenUp.name: Jimmy Butler
assetsGivenUp.note: Acquired from Bulls for Zach LaVine, Kris Dunn, and 2017 #7 pick (Lauri Markkanen)

assetsGivenUp.name: Zach LaVine
assetsGivenUp.note: UCLA guard, 2014 #13 overall pick

assetsGivenUp.name: Kris Dunn
assetsGivenUp.note: Providence guard, 2016 #5 overall pick

assetsGivenUp.name: 2017 1st Round Pick (#7)
assetsGivenUp.note: MIN 2017 1st round pick, became Lauri Markkanen for CHI

assetsGivenUp.name: Keita Bates-Diop
assetsGivenUp.note: Ohio State forward, 2018 2nd round pick, sent to DEN

assetsGivenUp.name: Shabazz Napier
assetsGivenUp.note: Guard, sent to DEN in 4-team trade

assetsGivenUp.name: Noah Vonleh
assetsGivenUp.note: Forward, sent to DEN in 4-team trade

assetsGivenUp.name: Jordan Bell
assetsGivenUp.note: Forward, sent to HOU in 4-team trade

assetsGivenUp.name: Patrick Beverley
assetsGivenUp.note: Arkansas guard, acquired from Grizzlies (MEM had just gotten him from LAC). MIN sent Jarrett Culver + Juancho Hernangomez to MEM.

assetsGivenUp.name: Jarrett Culver
assetsGivenUp.note: Texas Tech guard, 2019 #6 overall pick

assetsGivenUp.name: Juancho Hernangomez
assetsGivenUp.note: Spanish forward, acquired from DEN in same 4-team trade as Beasley

assetsGivenUp.name: Walker Kessler
assetsGivenUp.note: Auburn center, selected #22 by MEM, traded to MIN. MIN sent #19 pick (Jake LaRavia) + 2023 2nd round pick to MEM, received #22 (Kessler) + #29.

assetsGivenUp.name: 2022 1st Round Pick (#19)
assetsGivenUp.note: MIN original 2022 1st round pick, selected LaRavia for MEM

assetsGivenUp.name: 2023 2nd Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: MIN 2023 2nd round pick, sent to MEM; became #45 overall

assetsGivenUp.name: Jarred Vanderbilt
assetsGivenUp.note: Kentucky forward, acquired from Denver in same 4-team trade as Beasley. Same assets given up (shared trade).

assetsGivenUp.name: Leandro Bolmaro
assetsGivenUp.note: Argentine guard, selected #23 by NYK, traded to MIN for draft rights to Mathias Lessort + DET 2023 2nd round pick. Same draft night trade that brought McDaniels.

assetsGivenUp.name: Mathias Lessort
assetsGivenUp.note: Draft rights sent to NYK

assetsGivenUp.name: 2023 2nd Round Pick (via DET)
assetsGivenUp.note: Detroit's 2023 2nd round pick, sent to NYK; became #31 overall

assetsGivenUp.name: 2023 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: MIN 2023 1st round pick (unprotected), conveyed as #16 to UTA

assetsGivenUp.name: 2025 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: MIN 2025 1st round pick (unprotected), conveyed as #21 to UTA

assetsGivenUp.name: 2027 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: MIN 2027 1st round pick (unprotected)

assetsGivenUp.name: 2029 1st Round Pick
assetsGivenUp.note: MIN 2029 1st round pick (top-5 protected)

assetsGivenUp.name: 2026 1st Round Pick Swap
assetsGivenUp.note: Right to swap first round picks with Utah in 2026
